descendants.content: @mfeilner Hmm. I think I see what you mean, but I have to disagree a little there about emotional repression. Anger & sadness are healthy, natural & necessary human emotions. We need to grieve loss to stay healthy, and sadness helps us through that process. Healthy anger is necessary to help push us through into initiating positive change. For instance, I became a vegetarian in protest of how terribly animals are treated in the livestock industry, and how animal agriculture is poisoning the environment where I live. As a consumer our decisions in how we live directly impact our environment. Depression on the other hand, is the unhealthy, serious medical illness that requires treatment. A good way to avoid depression is to allow yourself to really feel your negative feelings and grieve and get angry enough to do your part in raising awareness, affecting change and fighting the good fight even when the odds are against us. 🤝 There's so much we can do. Even if we believe things like voting, boycotting & protesting don't work (they do if enough people do it), there are so many small things we can do that have a big impact, like stopping consuming so much, altering our lifestyles to needs-oriented instead of wants-oriented, growing our own food & sharing with our neighbors, cleaning up the beaches & forests, switching to bicycles & public transportation, so many things.
